intro: Dupatya spixiana, commonly known as the Spix's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and often showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in complex cymes. The plant is adapted to the humid and nutrient-poor conditions of the rainforest floor.
